thread.title: Tiger Woods to Begin Rehab for Back Surgery Soon
thread.title_full: Tiger Woods to Begin Rehab for Back Surgery Soon

author: Kelly Terez
title: Tiger Woods to Begin Rehab for Back Surgery Soon
text:
Share Article 
Miguel Tovar/LatinContent/Getty Images (MEXICO CITY) -- Tiger Woods is about to begin a long healing process after back surgery. 
According to ESPN , Woods underwent microdiscectomy surgery for the second time "to alleviate an impingement in a disk in his lower back." He had the same surgery in 2014, leaving him from playing competitively for three months. 
At a news conference in Mexico City on Tuesday, Woods said he felt "good," but he was a little "stiff." 
"I'll start my rehab soon, but it's a long and tedious process," he said at the news conference. "The last time, it took me a long time to come back. Some of the guys who have had it done said it took them over a year to be pain-free. I hope it doesn't take me that long to be pain-free.'' 
Woods also said he played the majority of 2015 in pain, which ended up being his worst season as a pro. 
For recovery from the Sept. 16 surgery, Woods will be out the rest of the year, but he said he hopes to return sometime in 2016. 
Copyright   Tuesday, October 20, 2015 at 7:44PM
